notes: First generation X250 midsize luxury sedan (2008-2015). Aluminum-intensive construction. Supercharged variants require premium fuel. Data sourced from Wikipedia Jaguar XF article, January 2025 revision.
Second generation X260 (2015-2024). Aluminum-intensive architecture. Sportbrake wagon introduced 2017. Data sourced from Wikipedia Jaguar XF article, January 2025 revision.

Fourth generation X351 full-size luxury sedan (2009-2019). All-aluminum monocoque construction. Available in standard and long-wheelbase. Supercharged engines require premium fuel and precise maintenance. Data sourced from Wikipedia Jaguar XJ article, January 2025 revision.

engines: 5.0L supercharged V8 (510 hp XKR, 550 hp XKR-S)
notes: Second generation X150 grand tourer (2006-2014). Aluminum construction. XKR and XKR-S performance variants feature supercharged V8. Discontinued after 2014, replaced by F-Type. Data sourced from Wikipedia Jaguar XK article, January 2025 revision.

First generation sports car X152 (2013-2024). Aluminum-intensive construction. Manual transmission available 2013-2015, reintroduced 2016. SVR performance variant introduced 2016. Data sourced from Wikipedia Jaguar F-Type article, January 2025 revision.

First generation compact luxury sedan X760 (2015-2024). Aluminum-intensive architecture. XE S and XE S V6 performance variants available. Data sourced from Wikipedia Jaguar XE article, January 2025 revision.

First generation F-Pace X761 (2016-present). Jaguar's first crossover SUV. Aluminum-intensive construction. SVR performance variant introduced 2018 with supercharged V8. Data sourced from Wikipedia Jaguar F-Pace article, January 2025 revision.

First generation compact crossover X540 (2017-present). Built on transverse-engine platform. Standard 9-speed automatic transmission. Data sourced from Wikipedia Jaguar E-Pace article, January 2025 revision.

engines: Dual electric motors (394 hp combined, 512 lb-ft)
notes: All-electric crossover with 90 kWh lithium-ion battery pack. 400V high-voltage system requires EV-certified technicians. Aluminum-intensive construction. Estimated 234-256 miles EPA range. Data sourced from Wikipedia Jaguar I-Pace article, January 2025 revision.
